snippet: Extrapolating from new data, a historian suggests that about 20 percent more died than previously thought.
abstract: Landmark study by historian J David Hacker in journal Civil War History revises long-held estimate of deaths in the Civil War upward by 20 percent, from 618,222 to 750,000; Hacker, a demographic historian, combed through newly digitized census data from the 19th century; his revised figure is already winning acceptance from scholars, and the publishing journal calls his work among the most consequential pieces ever to appear in its pages.
lead_paragraph: Extrapolating from new data, a historian suggests that about 20 percent more died than previously thought.

headline.seo: Civil War Toll Up by 20 Percent in New Estimate
headline.main: New Estimate Raises Civil War Death Toll
headline.print_headline: New Estimate Raises Civil War Death Toll
